summary:
Started with programming at the age of 13, i was back then considered a nerd. I consider that as a compliment. 
Because i didn't like the computer science curriculem at the end of the eighties went to study biology. At the start of my career i had in fact two careers, one in biology and one in Gaming. As president of one of the larger gaming associations in the Netherlands i helped promoting gaming and did some game development (all RPG or Board games). Back in 1990 i developed the Emphebion RPG game world, which i used as basis for creating the Emphebion LARP game system which is currently the biggest used LARP system in the Netherlands. 
In 1997 i made the switch from biology to IT and later on also to bioinformatics which i also consider as IT. 
Currently i am CEO at OpenSource Science B.V.


I've written over 70 ICT titles in the past 20 years. 

Married with Lena, children Maksim(2001), Karina(2006)

Specialties: Functional and technical design of computer programs, programming. Writing computer books. Designing Games. 
Programming Bioinformatics applications
